preGame.title: Pre-Game Setup
preGame.intro: MatchOps Local helps you track your teams' performance during games:
preGame.step1Desc: Add all available players with names. This is your master registry to select players from for games. You can add players at any time.
preGame.step2Desc: Organize players into teams if you have multiple squads (e.g., A-team, B-team, age groups). Teams can be reused across multiple games.
preGame.step3Desc: Create a season for long-term tracking or tournament for specific competitions. Get separate statistics for each tournament/season.
preGame.step4Desc: Set opponent, date, time, and game format. Link game to team and tournament/season if you want organized statistics.
preGame.step5Desc: Drag players from top bar onto field in your desired formation. Set goalkeeper, move players around, and plan positions.

afterGameSection.title: After the Game
afterGameSection.saveGame: Save game automatically or manually for later review
afterGameSection.assessPlayers: Rate player performance and add notes about each player's development
afterGameSection.viewStats: Review detailed statistics: goals, assists, playing time, ratings
afterGameSection.exportData: Export all your data in CSV format for further analysis or backup
afterGameSection.reviewGame: Review game events, tactical drawings, and formations

afterGame.title: After the Game
afterGame.saveGame: Save your game to review later or continue tracking
afterGame.assessPlayers: Rate player performance and add notes
afterGame.viewStats: View individual and team statistics across games
afterGame.exportData: Export your data for further analysis

mainConcepts.title: Main Concepts

mainConcepts.seasonDesc: Extended period of games with statistical tracking
mainConcepts.tournamentDesc: Specific competition or event with separate statistics

warmup.title: Match Preparation
warmup.section1Goal: Goal: Create a positive atmosphere and review the day's agenda.
section1Points: High fives, fist bumps, check-ins ‚Äì sharing how everyone is doing.
Day's themes (max 3, e.g.): Enjoy, Compete, Dribble or Pass.
Themes based on training ‚Äì can vary, but "Enjoy" is always included.
warmup.section2Goal: Goal: Raise body temperature, tune minds for the game.
section2Activities: Two lines + marker 5m away (cone/vest), circle around outside to the back of own line.
Jump to partner's side (2 times per movement).
Animal movements: inchworm, bear walk, duck walk (kids can suggest).
Sprints (approx. 5): standing start, sitting start, push-up start.
warmup.section3Goal: Goal: Activate ball touch and prepare for the game.
section3PairWorkPoints: Basic passing close ‚Üí further away (game stance, balls of feet, inside foot, care).
section3GoalieWarmupPoints: Throws/passes from close (2m) and further away:
Up, side, air, ground (getting used to the ball).
section3CombinedGoalieWarmupPoints: GK in goal ‚Üí wall pass ‚Üí shot from 16m / between pen. spot & box (coach can be wall).
warmup.section4Goal: Goal: Final preparations before the game.
section4Points: Timing just before entering the field (game leader ready).
duringGamePoints: Encourage good plays (e.g., fist bumps, "Yes!", "Just like we practiced!").
Let the player make their own decisions ‚Äì guide only off-the-ball players and subs if needed.
